column4: However, at least Ubuntu's stable releases actually have a kernel/software from this century...
HSF is software modem, and HCF is controllerless I believe
They are both very similar - use slightly different drivers though
You can go to www.linuxant.com and download drivers - they have a free 14.4 driver and a full driver which costs
Also, many people's phone lines can only do 28.8 - like mine.  That's why I use a wireless (as in mobile phone technology, not wi-fi) connection.
no - it's debian based - uses it's own repository but is very similar to debian, only simpler
I actually find the fact that Ubuntu uses it's own repo to be an advantage - no dealing with unstable/testing and non-standard packages
I always think it's a bit weird that people run Linux on Macs - isn't their main appeal Mac OS?
the mac is nice hardware - and I like my iBook G4 with linux better than OS-X
Linus Torvalds runs a G5 BTW
probably a dev library (that's the usual problem anyway)
grumpy will be the "everything breaks" unstable version ;)
not really - debian testing changes, breezy won't
